@jneira it's just huffman encoding - function application in Haskell is more important than lists, so it has shorter syntax.
@runarorama hello mate - I'm the author of Hubris. I'm still actively looking for good use cases, so let me know if you think of any...
@jneira it's so you can write [foo 1, bar 2, baz 3] - it'd be '((foo 1) (bar 2) (baz 3)) in a Lisp, I think.
